name: Grand Palladium Lady Hamilton Resort & Spa

reviews.text: What you see in the travel magazines, is what you get. Grand Palladium, Lady Hamilton is just as beautiful in person!! The Resort is amazing, the food wonderful (I am sure we gained at least 10 lbs.) and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We used the sunset cove beach the most, and the jerk chicken hut was so handy....and delicious!! Our room was 3407 with 2 walk out verandahs, the one had a beautiful view of the water and gazebo. There was a bit of an issue with the shower, but once we realized it leaked....a lot... we put a towel at the bottom of the door, and there were no problems after that! Bubbas steakhouse was great, and so was the seafood restaurant. We missed our reservations at the Italian restaurant, as we were late coming back from our Dunne River falls trip (that bus ride was long!), but the buffets each night were wonderful and more than enough variety of food (something for everyone). We did the Chukka tours combo trip with the inner tubing and 6 ziplines, which was an amazing day....and well worth the $$!! The week went way too fast, but we had a great relaxing vacation! The resort is large, so there is lots to see (not sure we saw it all) there is a lot of walking, but after eating so much, that wasn't a problem either. The entertainment staff went over and above what they needed to, they must have extremely long days....and nights! Thanks Grand Palladium, Lady Hamilton for an amazing time! We certainly would consider coming back!!
reviews.title: Just a wonderful holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, please disregard some of the people's bad reviews. I honestly cannot believe some people when they review all-inclusive s in poor countries. I think some people just like to complain for the sake of complaining.
reviews.title: Best Resort in Jamaica!!! You will not be disappointed!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is absolutely gorgeous. From the rooms to the beach you cannot go wrong booking at this place. I will give you a break down of my experiences and let you judge it for yourself.
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.text: Airport:
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bus was waiting for us as soon as we got our luggage. There will be people who will offer to take your bag to the appropriate bus (they will tell you what your bus name is depending on your resort). I suggest just bringing your own bags to the bus or else you will have to tip. The bus ride is about 40 minutes away (not long at all).
reviews.title: Pretty to look at.....and not much else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the trip was awesome. The people are super friendly and always there to help you. The food was really good....and Restaurants was amazing. word of advice though, always check witjh agent to see if they are all open. This resort had alot close and buffet was close has well. Not sure if theydo that because volume is not there etc....
reviews.title: Awesome trip in November 2011 - Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had great weather...lots of sunshine....
reviews.title: trip in january

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is nice....we wish we upgraded to a water view. Still alot renovations on the resort but it is very large and beautiful. We would go back for sure. It was great place for relaxation. Not whole lot of night life but there is sport bar/club and enternament every night.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Only disadvantage i would say is where the resort is located. It is very far from the Dunn's Falls/ Mystic Mountain. We left the resort at 8AM and disn't get back until 7PM......it was along day. So, when planning your excursions, be sure to check the distance.:)
reviews.title: Fantastic family vacation

reviews.text: keith & Michelle
reviews.title: Fantastic time in Jamaica!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I attended in January 2012 which was our second time to Jamaica. We had heard good things about this resort and booked a few days before we left. We did learn that they were not full during our stay.
reviews.title: A Jamaican Experience

reviews.text: We have stayed at a number of different resorts and this was again a Jamaican experience. No problem mon.
reviews.title: Repeat Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ARRIVAL
reviews.title: Grand time at the Grand Palladium Lady Hamilton

reviews.text: The arrival at the airport was quick and the process quite smooth even with a couple of planes landing at once. The gentlemen loading our luggage into the bus was quite nice until he starting asking for a tip (quite demanding). He was different than the driver so not sure who he was? The trip from the airport to the resort was approx. 45mins with a quick stop for a cold beverage. We were part of a bus load that arrived and greeted with a Rum Punch/cold towel. Our room was not ready so we took this opportunity to have lunch and scope out the property. The wait was short and we ended up in one of the villas by the waterfront.
reviews.title: great holiday

reviews.text: ACCOMODATIONS
reviews.title: Lady Hamilton

reviews.text: what a fabulous holiday.the staff were all so friendly & welcoming,from the ladies on reception to the people who tended the gardens,who gave me & my step daughter flowers which they picked as we passing by.we had 2 lovelyrooms with fabulous views over the sea & a short walk from everywhere.we were in block 26(nearest to the main buildings) .we wanted 2 rooms next to each other so they quickly changed our rooms upon arrival .they filled the mini bar everyday & on the one occasion that they forgot to leave clean towels,a quick call to reception soon put it rightThe only slightly annoying thing were the crickets that started as soon as it got dark,until morning.the buffet restaurant served a different themed selection every evening & breakfast choice was alwaysgood.Eunice made me a gorgeous omlette every day with whatever fillings i wanted.martin & marvin at the swimup bar were always friendly & made mean cocktails with plenty of rum usually.jean who worked in the above in the bar in the evening was very sweet.the beaches were clean & tidy & we used the pedalos on a number of occasions.nothing was too much trouble with any of the staff.the lifeguards & entertainment staff were great fun,music playedmost of the day.couple of thunderstorms that didnt stop us staying under the umbrellas on the loungers till they passed as quickly as they arrived(15 mins max).the pools were excellant although the lazy river was shut as it was low season to them.trips to dunns river falls on cool runnings & negril & sunset at Ricks Cafe were stunning .hot & sunny & friendly people on the island..we wouldnt hesitate in rushing back here again.absolutely loved it all. debbie,neil,andrew & nuala.crawley. sussex
reviews.title: excellant holiday.can't wait to go back

reviews.text: The Grand Palladium Lady Hamilton, Was absolutely beautiful. It was very clean. The food was very good a big selection. The Staff were really friendly. The beaches were clean and warm. The place was just beautiful , would go back for sure.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the GPLH 24th Sept- 8th October. We enjoyed the holiday, but this is definetely not a 5star hotel compared with similar hotels in other Caribbean resorts. The suite was ok and cleaned daily but we needed to have light bulbs replaced and the curtain rails fixed. The shower fitting was loose and continually slipped down but the bath was excellent. The rooms are in need of refurbishing as some floor tiles were cracked and the toilet was in a bit of a sorry state. There was no towel sculptures or extra little touches usually associated with 5* hotels. There was a good variety of food every day in the buffet and you could always get a steak cooked for you at the grill. My main criticism is that buffet food was often luke warm at best especially at breakfast. The al a carte restaurants were very good apart from the Indian where the service was very poor. We can highly recommend the tenderloin beef in the Italian, far better than the steak restaurant!! Sunset beach is by far the best beach as it is much easier to walk out and have a decent swim. The other beaches are quite rocky underfoot and definetely not suitable for children . In the bars the staff were nice and attentive but rarely had the ingredients needed for the cocktails. No mint for 3/4 days for mojitos; then no bananas for banana based cocktails. Piano bar kept running out of Baileys and in 2 weeks I never saw or heard the piano being played!! Overall we enjoyed the stay because of the people we met and the friendliness of the staff but would not return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Late break

reviews.text: My friend and I decided to leave the men at home and do a girls' trip to the Lady Hamilton. Everything was wonderful! I e-mailed the resort to ask for a room on a higher floor and got a very quick reply-and a great room. The service, food and drinks were all excellent. The only thing was that the beaches were not quite the white sand we were expecting-don't get me wrong, Sunset Cove was very nice, but it was just abit disappointing to read warnings about stingrays in the water! And the beds and pillows were rock hard-and I like a hard bed, but this was awful!!
reviews.title: Really nice resort

reviews.text: The hotel was maybe 25% full while we there there and the hotel is HUGE! Really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it without fail!
reviews.title: Great Trip

reviews.text: Before I took this trip, I read dozens of reviews to prepare. I'd like to return the favor by being as detailed as I can be.
reviews.title: A nice vacation spot

reviews.text: My experience at the GPLH was a nice one, for the most part. The resort itself is beautiful. The grounds are wonderfully maintained by a dedicated crew. I loved all the fruit trees and beautiful tropical flowers. I had fun watching for little lizards and other wildlife. The buildings look new and clean. I loved the main swimming pool and its swim up bar. The beaches are a little rocky (except for Sunset Cove), but nice. Buy water shoes. You can get a pair from one of the souvenir shops for around thirteen dollars.
reviews.title: Green grass, warm sea and blue sky!

reviews.text: Coral Beach was by far my favorite place. It has the best access to the reef, and I enjoyed snorkeling in that area. Unfortunately, the water sports rental office is located at Sunset Cove, and only lets you check out snorkeling equipment for an hour at a time. I had to ask very nicely to be allowed to take the equipment to a different beach, and promise to be back in time. There is also a twenty five dollar deposit, which I was not aware of. I suggest bringing your own gear.
reviews.title: Wedding Vacation of a lifetime!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oddly, there is a water sports stand near the main pool which does not actually rent equipment. It's existence was a mystery and an irritation to me.
reviews.title: brilliant

reviews.text: The restaurants were good. I'm afraid that the buffets upset my stomach quite a bit. I ate at the Cajun and steak restaurants. Both were tasty, thought my steak was overdone. The Cajun was my favorite. I strongly suggest the curried lamb.
reviews.title: Not as bad as we thought it would be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellent holiday at the GP Lady Hamilton, and the hotel compared favourably with our last holidays in GP Kantenah in Mexico (as we expected!!!) Travelled with First Choice from Birmingham 26 September - 10 October. (Good flights both ways - thank you.)
reviews.title: An Excellent Holiday in Jamaica

reviews.text: Check-in was quick (although we did not get a welcome drink - probably as we arrived earlier than anticipated) and easy. Transport provided to take us and our luggage to our room in Building 29. Lovely room - king size bed, sofa, table and chairs, balcony with two chairs and table (a bit disappointed that we did not have a sea view as I had emailed the hotel prior to our trip to request one if possible, but still, a nice view over the gardens with our morning cuppa.) Bathroom was HUGE - large walk-in shower, enormous jacuzzi bath, excellent lighting over the vanity unit, and the all important hairdryer. Fridge working and fully relenished during the whole of our stay. Room kept spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Worst customer service ever

reviews.text: All the grounds were immaculate and the gardeners and staff all so very friendly, always a pleasant word when we walked by them.
reviews.title: Great holiday would defiantly go back again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good - we had a slight problem one night in the buffet, but that was due to our personal tastes I must say, rather than the food on offer, and being rather late to go to one of the a la cartes. Breakfasts were superb, and the omelette man did a great job throughout our stay. Always the grill available if the other options in the buffet not to our taste. Steakhouse - went twice - both had the rib-eye first visit and one T-Bone and a fillet the second - mouth-wateringly tender and tasty, perfectly cooked to our taste. Oriental - went twice - again food lovely. Italian - well as it was my birthday we could book in advance, so arranged to go at 19:30. Arrived 19:15 for a drink beforehand, but were rushed straight to the table. We ordered, were directed to the salad bar (lovely scallops) and sat down, only to have our starter arrive before we had started our salad. All a bit rushed. Main course came when expected, but, although my partners tenderloin steak was really tasty and tender, my sea bass was severely over-salted and inedible. The whole visit felt very rushed - as if they were not expecting us (we did hand in our confirmation of reservation when we arrived.) This was the only slightly offputting experience we had, and a bit of a let down on what I had hoped would be a lovely birthday meal, but hardly enough to spoil an otherwise beautiful holiday, just a blip.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort with friedly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pretty beaches - lovely main pool area (lots of beds) adult pool and beach (usually quite busy, and not much shade available after 9 am when the beds with umbrellas were usually occupied) and quiet pool - plenty of places to cool off.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second visit to this property and we can not say enough about what a great experience it was. Top of the list is the friendly staff. It was rare if a staff person passed you and did not smile and greet you. The food was superiour, althought with no dedicated Jamaican restaurant you would have to rely on buffet for local cuisine, but even there we could eat great local fare. Can't say we found any negatives at this resort.
reviews.title: What a place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived the weather was cloudy, this gave us time to explore the hotel & grounds (largest in jamaica) and it didn't disapoint. most of the staff were friendly you did get a couple that were rude but we didn't let it bother us. the food in the buffet was great a lot of choice and always hot,the a la carte restaurants were also good especially bubbas and the xamaica.We were in villa 32 and had a perfect sea view , because it was away from the main areas it was quiet.the beaches are not the soft white sand you would expect in the caribbean but there is a choice. And do take water shoes its quite rocky underfoot when walking into the sea. The rooms were clean and spacious with a flat screen tv and mini bar.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Jamaica but not my first trip away to the islands. I would like to say the resort was absolutely fabulous, it was very clean, the staff was very friendly, the food was awesome and the weather was great. First tip, contact someone from the resort in the front lobby and they can arrange for your own personal tour guide - very cheap and he is your tour guide for the day or half a day. They have no room service but I arranged to have breakfast delivered to our room to surprise my wife and it was awesome. They have a private pool and beach for adults which was very nice.I would highly, highly recommend this resort to anyone.
reviews.title: Trip of a Life Time

reviews.text: Let me start off by saying I am not a snob. In fact I can stay at a motel 6 and be happy as long as its clean and there is AC! The resort was beautiful! Although not as pretty as pictured! Huge place.. I suggest asking the front desk to give you a room near the main lobby....ours was waaaaaayyy on the other side of the resort.... The room was clean and looked exactly like advertised. But......no Air conditioning......I have no problem walking back and forth from our room to the fun all day long if I have a nice cool room to come back to.....nope. It's amazing how no AC in 90 degree weather can ruin your trip. Could barely even sleep because I was covered in sweat... Cold showers weren't even relief enough..my husband spent our third night on a hammock on the beach...and that was the best nights sleep he got the entire time..it shouldn't be like that when you spend that amount of money.. Called front desk multiple times and walked to the lobby multiple times but it never got fixed.
reviews.title: Good and bad!

reviews.text: Food was okay. One night we went to the Mexican restaurant and waited an hour and a half for our food while sweating bullets....So the rest of the time we just went to the buffet. the juice bar was AMAZING and so were the mangoes.... Yummy!!
reviews.title: First experience of Jamaica

reviews.text: Just returned from spending 5 fantastic days at Grand Palladium Lady Hamilton Resort staying October 17th-21st 2012. It was an amazing vacation and by far the best one that we have ever been on. We are frequent travelers to the Caribbean All Inclusive Resorts. We have been going for 10 years now every year. This was our first time to Jamaica and our first time at a Grand Palladium. We usually have stayed at Iberostar or H10 Resorts in the past.
reviews.title: By Far The Best Vacation in 10 Years of Yearly Caribbean Stays

reviews.text: Background: I typically do a ton of research on the resort before we travel. After we booked in May of 2012 I stumbled upon the Palladium Addicts site. It gave me so much information I felt that I had made the best choice on resorts. I decided to join their group and found out that the very week that we had booked they were having a get together at the resort. What a fantastic group of people we had met and made some great friends. The party was so much fun and the week was incredible. They welcomed us and turned us into true Palladium Addicts.
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort - 10/22/12

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travel Group: My husband and I traveled with our 3 year old daughter and 4 other adults and a 16 year old. We are in our mid to upper 30’s. We booked through Apple Vacations via our Travel Agent that we always use. We joined the group of Addicts of approximately 60 other people when we arrived.
reviews.title: Fantastic resort, Hotel and Staff! Recommend to anyone and everyone!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Resort: Yes it is a 45 Min drive from the airport but we already knew that and we prefer to not be in a strip of resorts stacked on top of each other. The resort is large and we knew that and were prepared. We brought a jogging off road stroller for our daughter and could go anywhere. It is truly a magnificent resort placed on the side of a mountain with gullies, serene type bay areas, coves and inlets. I am sure we have only seen 25% of this resort as we were spoiled where our Villa was. The architecture is beautiful. The resort is only 4 years old and very well kept. It is the hot moist weathered Caribbean so yes there is wear and tear on some things but if you are going to critique a cracked tile here and there the tropical areas are not for you stay home. This was the most beautiful and largest resort we have ever been to. We were impressed.
reviews.title: Review from an English point of view!

reviews.text: Room: We had originally booked the Jamaica side but were placed on the LH side. I had emailed them with my requests for rooms and in the order of importance. We had booked a 1 Bedroom suite and requested that the other room for our friends was either adjoining or next to us as her daughter was our Nanny for the week. I had asked that if possible are entire group be in the same building or close to each other. We ended up in Villa 26 room 2630 Oceanfront Suite with our Nanny being right next door in room 2629. The other two rooms were in Villa 28 right next door with Ocean view rooms also. Check in was a breeze, took about ten mins for 3 room check ins. We got there at noon and they were still working on them and our other party had not arrived yet. We went to lunch and came back at 1PM and all 4 rooms were ready. We asked for extra room keys right away so we could leave one in the wall and each person could have a key and it was not a problem. The Villa was right next to the Main areas pool, Lobby etc. fantastic location. The room was huge with a separate King Bedroom and Living area, pull out sofa all made up for our daughter, huge jet tub, huge shower, lots of counter space and 2 very large balconies. The views were amazing. We expected a musty smell and brought small candles but never needed them, we expected hard beds and hard pillows and were surprised at how comfy they all were and we are use to a Temperpedic Mattress. Our AC was wonderful and I woke up needing blankets several mornings. The housekeeper Paula was wonderful. Our room was cleaned twice a day, always had towels, nightly turn down service and our fridge was always restocked and even with extras. We tipped her 3 out of the 5 days only because I forgot the other two but gave her extra, still had great service all days. Out of all 4 rooms 2630, 2629, 2829 and 2827 there were no real complaints. The open air courtyards in the Villas were beautiful and we did not mind walking up to the third floor even with a stroller. We left it by the bottom of the stairs all day with our pool stuff in it and brought it up at night with no problems. Nothing was ever touched. The tree frogs and crickets were loud but we could not hear them in our room. We were right next to the theater and never heard any noise in our room. There was only one night when we were in bed at midnight and we fell asleep just fine, the other night 3 and 4 am. If you kept your balcony door open then yes I could see the problem but who would do that it is really hot and humid.
reviews.title: Nice property...bad INFECTION

aka: Grand Palladium Lady Hamilton Hotel Lucea
description: The resort is bathed by the calm turquoise waters of Jamaica's north coast, in a small bay on a privileged enclave on the coast. The design is a perfect harmony between modernand luxurious facilities of a first class hotel and the attractive natural environment of the area characterized by the turquoise sea and the relief of the landscape. The complexalso houses an ultramodern Spa, which is equipped with the most advanced facilities and offers guests a wide variety of therapies and services. Near the village of Lucea and approximately 30 minutes from Montego Bay and its airport. Within the complex is theGrand Palladium Jamaica Resort & Spa has a total of 540 guestrooms in 15 villas ofthree levels with 6 Suites and 30 Junior Suites per villa. The Grand Palladium LadyHamilton Resort & Spa has a total of 516 rooms distributed in 13 villas of three levels with 6 suites and 30 Junior Suites per villa and 48 two-story cabins with 4 Cabins Suites(adults only) each.
